hints.content: Start by understanding the concept of free time. Free time is defined as the time intervals during which no meetings are scheduled. Consider how to calculate the gaps between the end of one meeting and the start of the next.
Remember that meetings are non-overlapping and are given in sorted order based on their start times. This means you can iterate through the meetings and find the free time intervals directly.
When calculating free time, consider the intervals before the first meeting and after the last meeting. These can contribute significantly to the total free time available.
Think about how rescheduling a meeting affects the free time. You can only move a meeting's start time while keeping its duration the same, so consider the constraints of the other meetings.
Identify the earliest start time and the latest end time of meetings. This will help you define the boundaries of your search for the maximum free time.

After calculating the initial free time without any rescheduling, focus on how moving each meeting affects the overall free time. Try to visualize or sketch how moving one meeting can create larger gaps.
When rescheduling a meeting, ensure that it does not overlap with any other meetings. This requires checking the new start and end times against all other meetings.
Consider edge cases, such as when all meetings are back-to-back or when there is only one meeting. How would these scenarios affect your calculations for free time?
As you explore rescheduling, keep track of the maximum free time found. You may want to maintain a variable that updates whenever you find a new maximum after testing each possible reschedule.
Finally, think about how you will return the maximum free time. You will need to ensure that your implementation captures all possible scenarios, including when no rescheduling is beneficial.

questionNotes: Meetings are non-overlapping and sorted by start times.
You can only reschedule one meeting.
Meetings must remain within the event time boundaries.
Return the maximum amount of free time possible after rearranging the meetings.
